Ok if you guys can\'t get videos to play on your PS3 I\'ll tell you how to do it correctly: Share a folder in windows and simply go to network and sharing center>>File/Media sharing = ON. Load your PS3, WHAT!? OMFG I HAVE A MEDIA SERVER!?!?!?!? lol... Congratulations you now don\'t need to burn transfer or do anything with your video files. Just share them on your network, and use your windows media server on your PS3. I watch everything this way at home.

Seeing comment with "Trojan inside" makes me wonder how many stupid idiots there are on the net that actually use their main PC to download material which has the possibility of containing a virus? Be smart.. use another and use Linux Ubuntu, run (if you want for your bit torrent client) WinXP in virtual box (like in Win7) and before you start downloading, make a snapshot (function similair to restore point in XP) of your system... Use a good Firewall to see what traffic is generated by what program so you can see if there really is a virus ... or tracker... and for playing will VLC almost play everything.
If you get a virus, disconnect... remove virus (from sandbox) and reload snapshot. 2 minutes work... reconnect and start downloading what you want (may:))
Oh and for the ones posting the virus warning.. 9 out of 10 in order of some movie company LOL as if...
